text-unit.text:
Please write an abstract. Please use only standard
LATEX
andTUGboatmacros in the abstract, notarticle-specific abbreviations or other macros; thathelps us make the web pages.

This is an example article forTUGboat, linked from
https://tug.org/TUGboat/location.html
.

The standardgraphicxandxcolorpackages workfine for image and color handling, respectively, asdoes thehyperrefpackage for active urls.TUG-boatis produced usingPDFfiles exclusively, butconversion fromDVIis fine and supported.
Please use the standard\urlcommand for urls:

ForTUGboat, we prefer not to print the ‘https://’,but to include the protocol in other cases, so weusually do\def\url{\tburl}, which takes care ofthat, while keeping the source using the standard\urlcommand.

In any case, please do
not
hide hyperlinks via\href, as in:
When printed on paper, the url will not be visibleand readers will not know it exists.
Theltugboatclass provides many abbreviation com-mands; here are a few of the most common:
For an em-dash with our spacing (preferred to---):\Dash, with output—like this.
For initialisms in all caps:\acro{FRED},with output:FRED.
A title:\titleref{Book of Fred},with output:Book of Fred.

We recommend using\begin{verbatim}[] ...\end{verbatim}for code blocks, since we prefer not to colorize code when printed. But if you want tohave some font changes, our recommended settingsfor thelistingspackage are in theltubguidman-ual mentioned below.
Please put punctuation outside quotes, “likethis”, unless the punctuation is actually part of thequoted material.
Also, please put punctuation after footnotes.

ForTUGboat, the standardfigureenvironment pro-duces a column-width figure; this is desirable whenat all possible. Thefigure*environment produces afull-width (across both columns) figure when needed.Analogously fortableandtable*.
Please put captions below figures, but abovetables.
Don’t worry overmuch about figure placements,as they will likely change with editing.
For references to other issues ofTUGboat, pleaseuse the formatvolno:issno, e.g., “TUGboat32:1”.

The primaryTUGboatstyle documentation istheltubguidmanual, available online at
ctan.org/pkg/tugboat
or locally withtexdoc tugboat. ForgeneralCTANpackage references, we recommendthat form, using/pkg/. If you need to refer to aspecific file onCTAN, use:https://mirror.ctan.org/path

We recommend using Bib
TEX
(but don’t requireit), with thetugboatBib
TEX
style. Thebibliodirectory onCTAN,
ctan.org/pkg/biblio
, providesfilestugboat.bibwith a complete bibliography ofTUGboat,texbook3.bibwith many common
TEX
-related books and articles, and plenty more.

XE
First Last
First Last
TEX

XE
First Last
First Last
LATEX
This is a column-width figure, made with\begin{figure}. Use{figure*}for a full-width(double-column) figure.
